GameTip.String: Press {KEY:HelmetSlot}, {KEY:SuitSlot}, {KEY:BackSlot}, {KEY:UniformSlot}, or {KEY:ToolBeltSlot} to toggle through interactions and slots on any slot item you're wearing. Press and hold to swap between that slot and your active hands.
Press {KEY:ToggleHandPower} or {KEY:SecondaryAction} to toggle what you're holding in your hands on or off.
Press {KEY:ToggleLight} to toggle your {THING:ItemSpaceHelmet} lights on or off quickly.
Press {KEY:EmoteWave} to make your character wave at other stationeers.
Press {KEY:Jetpack} to toggle your {THING:ItemSpacepack} propulsion on or off.
Press {KEY:ToggleUI} to toggle the User Interface on or off to get amazing screenshots or video.
Pressing {KEY:Ascend} makes you ascend when your {THING:ItemSpacepack} is on. Toggle your {THING:ItemSpacepack} on/off with {KEY:Jetpack}.
Pressing {KEY:Descend} will make you descend if your {THING:ItemSpacepack} is on. Toggle the {THING:ItemSpacepack} on/off using the {KEY:Jetpack} key.
Press {KEY:InventorySelect} to swap between an open inventory slot and your active hand.
Pressing {KEY:Drop} drops whatever's in your hand. Holding {KEY:Drop} throws it. Hold longer to throw further.
Pressing {KEY:SwapHands} swaps what hand is active. Pressing {KEY:ActiveHandSlot} will cycle through the interaction options on whatever is in your active hand.
Press {KEY:Internals} to quickly toggle your {THING:ItemSpaceHelmet} open or closed.
Press {KEY:Chatting} to start chatting to other players.

Press {KEY:RotateLeft} to rotate the construction cursor left, {KEY:RotateRight} to rotate right, {KEY:RotateUp} to rotate up, {KEY:RotateDown} to rotate down, {KEY:RotateRollLeft} to roll left, or {KEY:RotateRollRight} to roll right.
Space isn't as empty as it sounds.
Hold a {THING:ItemWeldingTorch} in one hand while turned on, and a stack of {THING:ItemIronSheets} in another in order to upgrade the build state of an {THING:StructureFrameIron}.
Place a stack of {THING:ItemIronOre} in a powered {THING:StructureArcFurnace} in order to smelt it into an {THING:ItemIronIngot}.

Place a {THING:MotherboardLogic} in a {THING:StructureComputer} to enable logic with an IC chip. You will be able to add conditions and actions that control the states of devices on the same data network.
When altering the quantity of something via a button in world, hold down {KEY:QuantityModifier} while clicking to use smaller increments.

Use a {THING:ItemKitLogicInputOutput} to create a {THING:StructureLogicReader} or {THING:StructureLogicWriter}. Readers allow you to read values from other devices, writers allow you to change values on devices. When combined with Math Units, you can make extremely complex automated systems.

Use a {THING:ItemKitLogicInputOutput} to create a {THING:StructureLogicBatchReader} or {THING:StructureLogicBatchWriter}. Readers allow you to read values from an entire group of other devices, writers allow you to change values on entire groups of other devices.

Use a {THING:StructureRecycler} to convert things you no longer want into usable reagents. Pass the outputted {THING:ItemReagentMix} into a {THING:StructureCentrifuge} to convert it back into ore, ready for a {THING:StructureFurnace}.

Use a {THING:StructureHydraulicPipeBender} to manufacture atmospheric items, such as the {THING:ItemKitAtmospherics} which allows you to build useful machines such as the {THING:StructureAirConditioner} or {THING:StructureFiltration}.
The more damaged your suit is, the less efficiently it will work. Duct tape can fix that.
The more damaged your suit is, the less efficiently it will work.
After the original Stationeers Handbook collapsed into a singularity, it was replaced by the Stationpedia. Press {KEY:Help} to open it for guidance in-game.
Your starting {THING:ItemEvaSuit} and {THING:ItemSpaceHelmet} will catch on fire in a hot temperatures. Use {THING:ItemHardSuit} in dangerous environments.
The Stationeers program was established by the Offworld Development Agency to support exploration of the Solar System, and beyond.
Paying attention to your suit warnings. They can help prevent disaster.
{THING:ItemHardBackpack} can carry more items, but can't carry you!
The more damaged your suit is, the less efficiently it will work.
If your station feels gloomy, lift your mood with tunes from the {THING:StructureKlaxon} or build your own sampler using logic.
{THING:StructureHarvie} allows you to fully automate the planting, growing and harvesting of plants.
The Extended Tooltips can be turned on/off in the Settings menu.
You can clear all open windows on your screen at once by pressing {KEY:HideAllWindows}.
{THING:ItemCrowbar} can be used to open unpowered doors and power controllers.
{THING:ItemMiningDrill} can be changed to 'Flatten' mode to help you create flat floors when mining.
The {THING:ItemWearLamp} can be used for illumination without wearing a helmet.
By holding {KEY:MouseControl} you can enable your mouse cursor and drag items in and out of your inventory or between slots.
The basic space helmet insulates Stationeers against everything from hard vacuum to weird cooking smells.
Physics is your friend. Until it's not.
The frictional adherence adjustor is a bi-rotational model with a columnated uni-grip. It's not just a screwdriver
It's not actually 'milk', but an Agrizero-patented synthesis of {THING:ItemSoyOil} and {THING:ItemFern}, delicately blended in the {THING:ApplianceChemistryStation}.
Illegal on Earth since the Chengdu Event, Norsec nuclear power cells found a new and drastically less safety-conscious market offworld.
Hungry? Cereal bars are compact, nutritious, and refreshingly low on radiation.
Sick of replacing normal filters? Medium and Heavy filters last 5x and 20x as long, but are more expensive.
